definition: Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
to surpass (old)
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: In the Warring States Period, wars often broke out between Zhao and the minority groups in the north.
sentences.chinese: 战国时，赵国和北方的少数民族之间经常爆发战争。

sentences.english: The military civilization of Zhao country that embodies to his was again done to be analysed on this foundation.
sentences.chinese: 在此基础上，又对其所体现的赵国军事文化作了剖析。

sentences.english: He is just one of the Warring States Period Zhao Ping Yuanjun Menke.
sentences.chinese: 他只不过是战国时期赵国平原君的一位门客。

sentences.english: The State of Wu always covetously eyed the State of Zhao.
sentences.chinese: 吴国一直雄视着赵国，虎视眈眈。

sentences.english: After Zhao implemented the reform, the army's fighting capacity was strengthened and won battles one after the other.
sentences.chinese: 赵国实行改革后，军队的战斗力加强了，连连打胜仗。

sentences.english: A minister, Pang Cong, was to accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 魏国大臣庞聪，将要陪魏太子到赵国去作人质。

sentences.english: Now, we're going to live in the State of Zhao that is far further away from Your Majesty's palace than the street.
sentences.chinese: 现在赵国离大王您的宫殿，比这里的街市远了许多。

sentences.english: One year, the State of Qin sent troops to attack Zhao and surrounded the capital of Handan.
sentences.chinese: 有一年，秦国出兵攻打赵国，并已经包围了都城邯郸。

sentences.english: Gong sun Long , is a famous scholar lived in the State of Zhao during the Warring States Period (475-221BC).
sentences.chinese: 战国时期，赵国有位名士叫公孙龙。

sentences.english: Lin Xiangru was the envoy the Zhao state detached to the Qin State.
sentences.chinese: 蔺相如是赵国出使秦国的使臣。

sentences.english: Prince Kui was a sober young man. He cared much about his country.
sentences.chinese: 太子悝是一位明理的年轻人，他深为赵国的安危担心。

sentences.english: Like Zhao Guoman, many entrepreneurs expressed their willingness to invest in Hefei.
sentences.chinese: 和赵国满一样，不少企业都表达了到合肥投资的意愿。

sentences.english: In the Warring States Period, Lin Xiangru, chief min-ister of the State of Zhao, was sent as an envoy to the State of Qin to ask the ruler of Qin to return a fine piece of jade to Zhao.
sentences.chinese: 战国时代，赵国的大臣蔺相如出使到秦国。

sentences.english: The military civilization of Zhao country that embodies to his as again done to be analysed on this foundation.
sentences.chinese: 在此基础上，又对其所体现的赵国军事文化作了剖析。

sentences.english: As was usual at the time, the king of Wei had to send his son to Zhao as a hostage.
sentences.chinese: 按照当时的惯例，魏王必须把太子送到赵国作为人质。

definition: the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
King Huiwen of Zhao 趙國|赵国, reigned 298-266 BC during the Warring States Period
the Qin army (model for the terracotta warriors)
battle of Changping of 260 BC, at which the Qin army 秦軍|秦军[Qin2 jun1] encircled and annihilated a Zhao army of 400,000
King Min of Qi (reigned 323-284 BC)
Wu state (in south China, in different historical periods)/Wu state 220-280, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权 the southernmost of the three Kingdoms
Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
Duke Mu of Qin, the first substantial king of Qin (ruled 659-621 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius
Prince Dan of Yan (-226 BC), commissioned the attempted assassination of King Ying Zheng of Qin 秦嬴政 (later the First Emperor 秦始皇) by Jing Ke 荆轲 in 227 BC
Yue state/generic term for states in south China or southeast Asia at different historical periods
the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
